intro: Dilatris hexandra, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
